title: Member Lecture: Manet and Modern Beauty
title_display: Member Lecture: Manet and Modern Beauty
hero_caption: Édouard Manet. Boating, 1874-1875. The Metropolitan Museum of Art, H.O. Havemeyer Collection, Bequest of Mrs. H.O. Havemeyer, 1929.
short_description: Hear from Kathryn Kremnitzer, Research Associate and Manet scholar, as she discusses the works from Manet and Modern Beauty.
description:
Hear from Kathryn Kremnitzer, Research Associate and Manet scholar, as she discusses the works from Manet and Modern Beauty.

The exhibition focuses on later years of Manet’s career when “the painter of modern life” was too ill to walk the city as he had done in the past. Instead, Manet constructed modern life in his studio and turned his focus to portraiture over the genre scenes that he was already known for.

For additional member programs, please visit the member programs calendar.
